page.title: 13TRAFFIC
page.content: Today the traffic in Dunfermline often comes to a standstill at the rush hour. This happens on such busy roads as Appin Crescent and East Port. At the High Street the traffic comes to a standstill not because of the rush hour but because of the construction of new buildings. The traffic is narrowed down to one lane because of scaffolding and also shuttering which stops falling masonry from hitting cars and pedestrians below. The main traffic problem in Dunfermline is probably car accidents which happen fairly often. Traffic coming in from the South at the moment is often rerouted because of the new road being built through the public park and this causes further problems.
